domain_configuration_protection_desactiv: Are you sure you want to disable protection for your {{t0}} domain?
When the protection is disabled, you will be able to access the AUTH/INFO code which means you can transfer domains by clicking on the relevant button.
Your domain uses DNSSEC, please check that your new service provider can manage it correctly. If they cannot do so, please disable the option before transferring your domain.
domain_configuration_protection_auth_inf: To transfer your domain name away from OVH, you should contact the Registry to get the auth-info code. You can do this via the link: {{t0}}
domain_configuration_protection_desactiv: Activating Domain Protection enables you to protect yourself against theft by forbidding all transfers.

All companies that register domain names also offer the possibility to transfer incoming domain names managed by other providers. The company requesting the transfer must ensure that the transaction has actually been requested by the owner.
If the checks are not carried out in sufficient depth, the domain can still be moved, and the rightful owner could lose management of their domain name.
How does OVH protect you from domain theft?

In order to protect you against theft, we automatically lock the domain in a state where no transfer can be made. If another registrar requests the transfer of this domain, it will be immediately refused by default, thus no transfer can be made without your knowledge.
If you later wish to transfer your domain name to another registrar, you will then have to deactivate the domain protection.
Domain protection will be disabled. The transfer code will be available in a few minutes.
Error when requesting to disable the domain protection
domain_configuration_protection_activate: Are you sure you want to enable protection for your {{t0}} domain?
Activating Domain Protection enables you to protect yourself against theft by forbidding all transfers.

All companies that register domain names also offer the possibility to transfer incoming domain names managed by other providers. The company requesting the transfer must ensure that the transaction has actually been requested by the owner.
If the checks are not carried out in sufficient depth, the domain can still be moved, and the rightful owner could lose management of their domain name.
How does OVH protect you from domain theft?

In order to protect you against theft, we automatically lock the domain in a state where no transfer can be made. If another registrar requests the transfer of this domain, it will be immediately refused by default, thus no transfer can be made without your knowledge.
If you later wish to transfer your domain name to another registrar, you will then have to deactivate the domain protection.
The domain protection will be enabled
domain_configuration_whois_step1_questio: Please choose whether you would like your personal information to be displayed or hidden in the WHOIS directory for the {{t0}} domain
domain_configuration_whois_step1_helpwiz:
When you register a domain name, you will be asked for personal details. These are published by default in the WHOIS database, which is publicly accessible.
This function lets you hide information if you wish to.
WHOIS is a public search facility for information on domain names and IP addresses. This database mainly consists of information on the owners.
What information is published in WHOIS?

The details published are the domain name owner's. They depend on the domain name extension, but in general they will be :
  • their address
  • Their phone and fax number
  • Their e-mail

All three pieces of information can be masked.
How does OVH enable you to hide this information?

If you enable this service, OVH will replace your personal information with generic information. However you will stay contactable.
  • The address field is replaced with an OVH address and we send the emails to the real recipient.
  • The telephone and fax fields are replaced by an OwO number.
  • The email field is replaced by a redirection which points towards the owner's email address. This address is regenerated regularly and an anti-SPAM filter is applied.

domain_configuration_dns_entry_add_title: Add an entry to the DNS zone
domain_configuration_dns_entry_add_step1: DNS Zone â€“ Adding an entry
Here's a quick description of the different types of entry that can be added to your DNS zone.
Allows a domain name or sub-domain to be linked to an IPv4 address.
Allows a domain name or sub-domain to be linked to an IPv6 address.
An alias for the An record, useful for finding out alternative names for a host's services.
Enables the distribution of keys that allow a mail server to verify DKIM signatures (useful in the fight against SPAM).
Specifies a geographic area associated with the domain name.
Specifies the mail server responsible for e-mail distribution for a domain.
Allows the public services that you provide under a domain name to be specified.
Allows the authoritative servers for the zone to be declared.
Assures remote mail servers that your servers are fully authorised to send emails. Useful in the fight against SPAM.
Allows you to define the address and port number of servers for specified services. An extended and more generic version of the MX record.
Allows public SSH keys to be listed in the DNS system, helping to verify the authenticity of the host machine.
Allows any text to be entered in the DNS zone.
